New Records: Quinton de Kock scored 74 runs, his 15th T20I half-century.
Kagiso Rabada took 3 wickets and conceded only 18 runs in 4 overs.
Key Match Events: South Africa defeated the USA by 18 runs in their Super Eight match.
The match was closer than expected, with the USA needing 92 runs off the last six overs.
Rabada dismissed Andries Gous and Harmeet Singh, key players for the USA.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa set a high score of 194 for the loss of four wickets.
Quinton de Kock and Aiden Markram contributed significantly to the total with 74 and 46 runs, respectively.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory was seen as a pivotal moment for South Africa in the tournament.
The Proteas' next game is against England, with a win securing a spot in the semifinals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The USA's chase was stuttering, with regular wicket falls.
The 18th over bowled by Tabraiz Shamsi went for 22 runs, a significant moment in the match.
